p: Climatic variables were consistently among the most important predictors for each species across models (Table 2). Precipitation variables in particular were consistently important for each species, especially annual precipitation and precipitation of the driest month. Temperature variables were consistently important for R. cathartica, F. alnus, and R. multiflora, but not for A. petiolata. Non-climate variables, particularly soil particle size and elevation, were more important for A. petiolata relative to the other species.
